perturbation.original_text: 13.7 Waiver of Jury Trial. EACH OF THE PARTIES HERETO IRREVOCABLY WAIVES ANY AND ALL RIGHT TO TRIAL BY JURY IN ANY LEGAL PROCEEDING ARISING OUT OF OR RELATED TO THIS AGREEMENT OR THE TRANSACTIONS CONTEMPLATED HEREBY.
perturbation.changed_text: 13.19 Employee Benefits. EACH OF THE PARTIES HERETO IRREVOCABLY WAIVES ANY AND ALL RIGHT TO TRIAL BY JURY IN ANY LEGAL PROCEEDING ARISING OUT OF OR RELATED TO THIS AGREEMENT OR THE TRANSACTIONS CONTEMPLATED HEREBY.
perturbation.explanation: The relocation of the 'Waiver of Jury Trial' clause from the 'Dispute Resolution' section to a newly created 'Employee Benefits' section makes it less likely that parties will be aware of this waiver when disputes arise, diminishing its enforceability. Courts usually expect waivers of jury trials to be conspicuously placed and clearly understood.
perturbation.contradicted_law: 7th Amendment to the United States Constitution. Although the right to a jury trial is not absolute and can be waived, the waiver must be knowing and voluntary. By placing this clause in an unexpected section, it can be argued that the waiver was not made knowingly.
